If I post advice or an opinion to help someone out, there's Ajube calling me a noob or an idiot almost every damned time. @t_amante
The top/bottom bars are big because the aspect ratio of this film is 2.39:1. That's around 21:9.

Where The Avengers Blu-ray is 1.78:1, that's 16:9. Even though the original aspect ratio is 1.85:1 (about 17:9). There really should have been bars at the top/bottom of the Blu-ray release of Avengers. But I guess the Blu-ray people chose to crop the sides off instead.

Remember just because it's a 1080p movie doesn't mean it has to be 1920x1080. It can be 1920xAnything.

Once and for all, folks: For a movie have exact 1920x1080 he must have a ratio of 16:9, and only some movies are filmed in that proportion. Most have 1920x800, 1920x900, etc.. So in summary, if the film is 1920x? then he IS 1080p.

As for this release, I concluded by comparison it is a upscale from 720p, so do not waste your time with it if you are looking for a real 1080p.
